title: Integrating Large Language Models in Political Discourse Studies on Social Media: Challenges of Validating an LLMs-in-the-loop
snippet: This paper mentions Giglietto's (2024) research, noting that LLMs outperform fully fine-tuned transformer models in NLP tasks using the same dataset. It also lists Giada Marino and Fabio Giglietto as copyright holders.
description: This paper, focusing on the integration of Large Language Models in political discourse studies on social media, mentions Fabio Giglietto as a copyright holder and references his 2024 research, suggesting relevance to his academic work.

title: Empowering People in Online Spaces: Democracy and Well-Being in Digital Societies - Weizenbaum Institut
snippet: This report references Fabio Giglietto & Massimo Terenzi, 2024 in the context of disinformation analysis.
description: This report from the Weizenbaum Institut proceedings mentions Fabio Giglietto in the context of disinformation analysis research, citing a 2024 publication with Massimo Terenzi. It appears to be a relevant, third-party mention related to his research area.

title: Un an de la alegerile anulate. Șocul continuă - EURACTIV.ro
snippet: This article mentions that data analysis was conducted by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi, University of Urbino, for the PROMPT project, concerning coordinated inauthentic behavior in the re-run of Romanian elections.
description: This Euractiv.ro article discusses data analysis conducted by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi from the University of Urbino for the PROMPT project, focusing on coordinated inauthentic behavior during the re-run of Romanian elections.

title: SOCIAL NETWORK ANALYSIS - Lecturer: Fabio Giglietto - A.Y. 2023/2024 - Credits 6
snippet: Announcement of Fabio Giglietto's Social Network Analysis course at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo for the academic year 2023/2024.  The course aims to provide an overview of the methods of studying the Network and digital media, to teach the basics of the programming language for statistical processing "R", to introduce social network analysis, also using the Gephi software, and online communication as it manifests on social media.
description: The content announces Fabio Giglietto's Social Network Analysis course at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo for the academic year 2023/2024, covering relevant topics such as social media analysis and network analysis methods.
